result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory M Casper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time (without work released).  Sentence credit for 116 days were granted if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 2.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.
No employment with children under the age of 18 unless approved by Agent.

No contact with the victim, her mother, or any unsupervised contact female under the age of 18.
Agent to have access to any of the defendant's electronic communication, passwords, Internet activity.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Sign medical Release for Agent.
Agent to evaluate the need of sex offender registration and report to the courts by 1/17/2018.
Review hearing scheduled for January 17, 2018 at 8:30 a.m.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
